info.title: Customer Address
info.description:
The Customer Address resource represents addresses that a customer has added. Each customer can have multiple addresses associated with them.

For more information about the Customer resource, see Customer.

paths.description: Retrieves a list of addresses for a customer. This endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Making requests to paginated REST Admin API endpoints.
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of addresses for a customer

200.description: Retrieves a list of addresses for a customer

x-examples.name: Retrieve all of a customer’s addresses

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.all(
  session: test_session,
  customer_id: 207119551,
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve a limited number of addresses for a customer

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses.json?limit=1" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.all(
  session: test_session,
  customer_id: 207119551,
  limit: "1",
)

paths.description: Creates a new address for a customer.
paths.summary: Creates a new address for a customer

201.description: Creates a new address for a customer

Create a new address for a customer.value: {"customer_address":{"id":1053317287,"customer_id":207119551,"first_name":"Samuel","last_name":"de Champlain","company":"Fancy Co.","address1":"1 Rue des Carrieres","address2":"Suite 1234","city":"Montreal","province":"Quebec","country":"Canada","zip":"G1R 4P5","phone":"819-555-5555","name":"Samuel de Champlain","province_code":"QC","country_code":"CA","country_name":"Canada","default":false}}

response.body: {"customer_address":{"id":1053317287,"customer_id":207119551,"first_name":"Samuel","last_name":"de Champlain","company":"Fancy Co.","address1":"1 Rue des Carrieres","address2":"Suite 1234","city":"Montreal","province":"Quebec","country":"Canada","zip":"G1R 4P5","phone":"819-555-5555","name":"Samuel de Champlain","province_code":"QC","country_code":"CA","country_name":"Canada","default":false}}

x-examples.name: Create a new address for a customer

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"address":{"address1":"1 Rue des Carrieres","address2":"Suite 1234","city":"Montreal","company":"Fancy Co.","first_name":"Samuel","last_name":"de Champlain","phone":"819-555-5555","province":"Quebec","country":"Canada","zip":"G1R 4P5","name":"Samuel de Champlain","province_code":"QC","country_code":"CA","country_name":"Canada"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

customer_address = ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.new(session: test_session)
customer_address.customer_id = 207119551
customer_address.address1 = "1 Rue des Carrieres"
customer_address.address2 = "Suite 1234"
customer_address.city = "Montreal"
customer_address.company = "Fancy Co."
customer_address.first_name = "Samuel"
customer_address.last_name = "de Champlain"
customer_address.phone = "819-555-5555"
customer_address.province = "Quebec"
customer_address.country = "Canada"
customer_address.zip = "G1R 4P5"
customer_address.name = "Samuel de Champlain"
customer_address.province_code = "QC"
customer_address.country_code = "CA"
customer_address.country_name = "Canada"
customer_address.save()

paths.description: Retrieves details for a single customer address.
paths.summary: Retrieves details for a single customer address

200.description: Retrieves details for a single customer address

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses/207119551.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.find(
  session: test_session,
  customer_id: 207119551,
  id: 207119551,
)

x-examples.name: Update the postal code of a customer address

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"address":{"id":207119551,"zip":"90210"}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses/207119551.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

customer_address = ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.new(session: test_session)
customer_address.customer_id = 207119551
customer_address.id = 207119551
customer_address.zip = "90210"
customer_address.save()

paths.description: Removes an address from a customer’s address list.
paths.summary: Removes an address from a customer’s address list

200.description: Removes an address from a customer’s address list

422.description: Removes an address from a customer’s address list

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses/1053317288.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.delete(
  session: test_session,
  customer_id: 207119551,
  id: 1053317288,
)

x-examples.name: Removing a customer’s default address fails and returns an error

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses/207119551.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.delete(
  session: test_session,
  customer_id: 207119551,
  id: 207119551,
)

paths.description: Performs bulk operations for multiple customer addresses.
paths.summary: Performs bulk operations for multiple customer addresses

parameters.name: address_ids[]
parameters.description: Performs bulk operations for customer addresses specified by a comma-separated list of IDs.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Operation to perform by keyword (for example, destroy)

200.description: Performs bulk operations for multiple customer addresses

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses/set.json?address_ids%5B%5D=1053317289&operation=destroy" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

customer_address = ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.new(session: test_session)
customer_address.customer_id = 207119551
customer_address.set(
  session: test_session,
  address_ids: ["1053317289"],
  operation: "destroy",
)

paths.description: Sets the default address for a customer.
paths.summary: Sets the default address for a customer

200.description: Sets the default address for a customer

x-examples.name: Set a default address for a customer

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/customers/207119551/addresses/1053317290/default.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

customer_address = ShopifyAPI::CustomerAddress.new(session: test_session)
customer_address.customer_id = 207119551
customer_address.id = 1053317290
customer_address.default(
  session: test_session,
)

properties.description: An additional field for the customer's mailing address.
properties.name: address2

properties.description: The customer's city, town, or village.
properties.name: city

properties.description: The two-letter country code corresponding to the customer's country.
properties.name: country_code

properties.description: The unique identifier for the customer.
properties.name: customer_id

properties.description: The unique identifier for the address.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The customer’s first and last names.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The customer’s phone number at this address.
properties.name: phone

properties.description: The customer’s region name. Typically a province, a state, or a prefecture.
properties.name: province

properties.description: The two-letter code for the customer’s region.
properties.name: province_code

properties.description: The customer’s postal code, also known as zip, postcode, Eircode, etc.
properties.name: zip

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Manage the customer addresses for a store. Customers can have multiple addresses, one of which is the default address that's used to calculate taxes and shipping charges.
